answers.answer: Looks like you have mild fatty liver(  steatosis )and have bridging fibrous,in between stage 3 and 4 of  liver damage
I reversed some of the fatty liver in a year, when I found out I stop drinking. Wondering if it is possible to reverse more liver damage...

Best way to reverse fatty liver is to get down to ideal weight and stay there,also consume good fats,not red meat fats and trans fats,olive oils and coconut oils are great.And stay away from high frutose corn sugar,its really heavy on the liver.

Researchers put 16 volunteers on a controlled diet, supplemented with either fructose (derived from corn) or glucose. After 10 weeks, both groups of participants had gained equal amounts of weight. Participants in the fructose group, however, showed an increase of fat cells around major organs including their hearts and livers, and also underwent metabolic changes that are precursors to heart disease and diabetes.http://www.naturalnews.com/028698_fructose_diabetes.html
